determineColours

public static java.util.Vector determineColours(int numberOfColours,
                                                boolean jumbled)
Given a number of colours needed, this function produces a set of such colours where the colours are as distinguishable as possible. The number of colours produced will usually be in excess of the number needed, so it is possible to jumble the colours so that similar colours are not close together when one iterates through the vector.

Parameters:
numberOfColours - int number of colours required
jumbled - boolean indicating whether the colours should be jumbled
Returns:
Vector of colours which contains at least the number of colours required

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
